meanings.definition: A person who advocates for a monetary system based on two metals, typically gold and silver.
meanings.sent1: The bimetallist believed in using both gold and silver for money.
meanings.sent2: The bimetallist presented a strong case for a dual-metal currency system.
meanings.sent3: The bimetallist joked that carrying both gold and silver coins made their pockets heavier.
meanings.sent4: She was a bimetallist, seeing the value in having two different metals as currency.
meanings.sent5: The bimetallist's passion for a dual-metal monetary system was unwavering.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a monetary system based on two metals, typically gold and silver.
meanings.sent1: The bimetallist approach to currency was gaining popularity.
meanings.sent2: The bimetallist policy aimed to stabilize the economy by using both gold and silver.
meanings.sent3: The bimetallist design of the coins impressed everyone with its uniqueness.
meanings.sent4: Her jewelry had a bimetallist look, combining gold and silver seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The bimetallist concept brought a new perspective to the world of economics.
